thread.title: Brambles sees increase in investment spending, reiterates weak earnings forecast
thread.title_full: Brambles sees increase in investment spending, reiterates weak earnings forecast | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: MITCHELL NEEMS
title: Brambles sees increase in investment spending, reiterates weak earnings forecast
text:
PALLET maker and logistics group Brambles has outlined a plan to increase capital investment but reiterated its soft earnings forecast from a month earlier.
Brambles told an investment market briefing in California that it was expecting growth in investment of $US1.5 billion ($2.1 billion) over next four years.
Growth in capital expenditure was likely to be heavily weighted towards well-established businesses.
Looking ahead to its objectives four years out, Brambles said its average capital invested compounded annual growth rate was likely to exceed the original 5 per cent expectation.
The company reiterated its target for an underlying profit of $US1 billion to $US1.02 billion for the year to next June, representing growth between 6 per cent and 8 per cent.
The average analyst expectation was for growth of 10 per cent.
The forecasts were made last month with Brambles' full-year results, which included a net profit after tax for the group's continuing operations of $US584.4 million for the year ending June.
That figures was down 54 per cent from a year earlier, when it was inflated by the demerger of document storage business Recall.
Originally published as Brambles eyes investment lift
